sn22.4:1.4: Once again Hāliddikāni names and quotes an abstruse passage (see DN 21:2.6.12 and note).
sn22.4:3.1: The set of defilements here express a gradual process: from being attracted to something, to picking it up, solidifying a sense of ownership in one’s mind, then insisting on clinging to it, until finally it becomes an inherent part of you. See SN 12.15:2.4 and note.
